fr.amap.commons.util

Class ColorGradient

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.amap.commons.util.ColorGradient

  • public class ColorGradient
extends Object
    This class can be used to generate gradient from a color to another or to simulate a color ramp
    Author:
    took from jeeb\\lib\\util

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Color[] GRADIENT_BLACK_TO_WHITE
      Produces a gradient from black (low) to white (high)
      static Color[] GRADIENT_BLUE_TO_RED
      Produces a gradient from blue (low) to red (high)
      static Color[] GRADIENT_GREEN_YELLOW_ORANGE_RED
      Produces a gradient through green, yellow, orange, red
      static Color[] GRADIENT_HEAT
      Produces a different gradient for hot things (black, brown, orange, white)
      static Color[] GRADIENT_HOT
      Produces a gradient for hot things (black, red, orange, yellow, white)
      static Color[] GRADIENT_MAROON_TO_GOLD
      Produces a gradient using the University of Minnesota's school colors, from maroon (low) to gold (high)
      static Color[] GRADIENT_RAINBOW
      Produces a gradient through the rainbow: violet, blue, green, yellow, orange, red
      static Color[] GRADIENT_RAINBOW2 
      static Color[] GRADIENT_RAINBOW3 
      static Color[] GRADIENT_RED_TO_GREEN
      Produces a gradient from red (low) to green (high)

      Produces a gradient through red, orange, yellow
      static Color[] GRADIENT_TREE 
      static Color[] GRADIENT_WHITE_TO_BLACK
      Produces a gradient from white (low) to red (high)
      static Color[] GRADIENT_WHITE_TO_RED
      Produces a gradient from white (low) to red (high)

      • createGradient

        public static Color[] createGradient(Color one,
                                     Color two,
                                     int numSteps)
        Creates an array of Color objects for use as a gradient, using a linear interpolation between the two specified colors.
        Parameters:
        one - Color used for the bottom of the gradient
        two - Color used for the top of the gradient
        numSteps - The number of steps in the gradient. 250 is a good number.
        Returns:

      • createMultiGradient

        public static Color[] createMultiGradient(Color[] colors,
                                          int numSteps)
        Creates an array of Color objects for use as a gradient, using an array of Color objects. It uses a linear interpolation between each pair of points.
        Parameters:
        colors - An array of Color objects used for the gradient. The Color at index 0 will be the lowest color.
        numSteps - The number of steps in the gradient. 250 is a good number.
        Returns:
